The art of medicine is a blend of the intellectual and the practical, concerned with how diseases work and how to prevent them. The physician can be found consulting well-thumbed tomes while meticulously examining patients to better understand their condition, before determining the most effective treatment. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47)): DC 13 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 11 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 8 [Physician](/NPCs.aspx?ID=3480) **Source** [NPC Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=236) pg. 60 **Perception** +6; (8 to notice ailments) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1) **Skills** [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39) +6, [Medicine](/Skills.aspx?ID=42) +12, [Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=47) +5 **Str** -1 **Dex** +1 **Con** +1 **Int** +4 **Wis** +2 **Cha** +2 **Medical Specialist** For medical matters, the physician is a 4th-level challenge.
**Bedside Manner** A physician has a +4 circumstance bonus to [Diplomacy](/Skills.aspx?ID=39) checks to [Make an Impression](/Actions.aspx?ID=2392) on or make a [Request](/Actions.aspx?ID=2393) of a [diseased](/Traits.aspx?ID=578), [poisoned](/Traits.aspx?ID=669), or wounded creature.
**Doctor's Hand** When the physician rolls a critical failure on a check to [Treat Disease](/Actions.aspx?ID=2397), [Treat Poison](/Actions.aspx?ID=2398), or [Treat Wounds](/Actions.aspx?ID=2399), they get a failure instead. **Items** [minor elixir of life](/Equipment.aspx?ID=91) (2), [Healer's Toolkit](/Equipment.aspx?ID=2727), medical textbook --- **AC** 13 **Fort** +9 **Ref** +3 **Will** +8 **HP** 8 --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** fist +5 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=179), [Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [Unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199)), **Damage** 1d4–1 bludgeoning **Ranged** medical textbook +5 ([Nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188), [thrown 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195)), **Damage** 1d4–1 bludgeoning
